intro: Cascarilla bullata, commonly known as the bullate cascarilla, is a shrub native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered leaves. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are often followed by red or orange berries. The fruit is used in traditional medicine and as a flavoring agent due to its aromatic properties.
